originContent: Enterprise-grade GitHub Action for policy-based approval workflows with per-group thresholds (X of N), OR logic between groups, and automatic semver tag creation.
translatedContent: Enterprise-grade GitHub Action for policy-based approval workflows with per-group thresholds (X of N), OR logic between groups, and automatic semver tag creation.

originContent: - **Flexible Approval Logic**: Support for both AND (all must approve) and threshold (X of N) logic within groups
translatedContent: - **Flexible Approval Logic**: Support for both AND (all must approve) and threshold (X of N) logic within groups

originContent: - **OR Logic Between Groups**: Multiple approval paths - any one group meeting requirements approves the request
translatedContent: - **OR Logic Between Groups**: Multiple approval paths - any one group meeting requirements approves the request

originContent: - **Mixed Approvers**: Combine individual users and GitHub teams in the same group
translatedContent: - **Mixed Approvers**: Combine individual users and GitHub teams in the same group

originContent: - **Progressive Deployment Pipelines**: Single-issue tracking through multiple environments (dev â†’ qa â†’ stage â†’ prod)
translatedContent: - **Progressive Deployment Pipelines**: Single-issue tracking through multiple environments (dev â†’ qa â†’ stage â†’ prod)

originContent: - **Pipeline Visualization**: Color-coded Mermaid flowchart diagrams showing deployment progress
translatedContent: - **Pipeline Visualization**: Color-coded Mermaid flowchart diagrams showing deployment progress

originContent: - **Sub-Issue Approvals**: Create dedicated approval sub-issues for each stage - close to approve
translatedContent: - **Sub-Issue Approvals**: Create dedicated approval sub-issues for each stage - close to approve

originContent: - **Enhanced Comments UX**: Emoji reactions on approval comments, Quick Actions section with command reference
translatedContent: - **Enhanced Comments UX**: Emoji reactions on approval comments, Quick Actions section with command reference

originContent: - **Issue Close Protection**: Prevent unauthorized users from closing approval issues (auto-reopen)
translatedContent: - **Issue Close Protection**: Prevent unauthorized users from closing approval issues (auto-reopen)

originContent: - **Hybrid Approval Modes**: Mix comment-based and sub-issue approvals per workflow or stage
translatedContent: - **Hybrid Approval Modes**: Mix comment-based and sub-issue approvals per workflow or stage

originContent: - **PR and Commit Tracking**: Automatically list PRs and commits in deployment issues for release management
translatedContent: - **PR and Commit Tracking**: Automatically list PRs and commits in deployment issues for release management

originContent: - **Semver Tag Creation**: Automatically create git tags upon approval
translatedContent: - **Semver Tag Creation**: Automatically create git tags upon approval

originContent: - **Policy-Based Configuration**: Define reusable approval policies in YAML
translatedContent: - **Policy-Based Configuration**: Define reusable approval policies in YAML

originContent: - **Issue-Based Workflow**: Transparent audit trail through GitHub issues
translatedContent: - **Issue-Based Workflow**: Transparent audit trail through GitHub issues

originContent: - **Jira Integration**: Extract issue keys from commits, display in approval issues, update Fix Versions
translatedContent: - **Jira Integration**: Extract issue keys from commits, display in approval issues, update Fix Versions

originContent: - **Deployment Tracking**: Create GitHub deployments for visibility in deployment dashboard
translatedContent: - **Deployment Tracking**: Create GitHub deployments for visibility in deployment dashboard

originContent: - **External Config**: Centralize approval policies in a shared repository
translatedContent: - **External Config**: Centralize approval policies in a shared repository

originContent: - **Rate Limit Handling**: Automatic retry with exponential backoff for GitHub API rate limits
translatedContent: - **Rate Limit Handling**: Automatic retry with exponential backoff for GitHub API rate limits

originContent: - **GitHub Enterprise Server**: Full support for GHES environments
translatedContent: - **GitHub Enterprise Server**: Full support for GHES environments

originContent: - **No External Dependencies**: Pure GitHub Actions, no external services required
translatedContent: - **No External Dependencies**: Pure GitHub Actions, no external services required

originContent: # OR logic: either path satisfies approval
translatedContent: # OR logic: either path satisfies approval

originContent: The action supports four operation modes via the `action` input:
translatedContent: The action supports four operation modes via the `action` input:

originContent: | `request` | Create a new approval request issue | When starting a deployment/release workflow |
translatedContent: | `request` | Create a new approval request issue | When starting a deployment/release workflow |

originContent: | `process-comment` | Process an approval/denial comment | On `issue_comment` events |
translatedContent: | `process-comment` | Process an approval/denial comment | On `issue_comment` events |

originContent: | `check` | Check the current approval status | To poll for approval completion |
translatedContent: | `check` | Check the current approval status | To poll for approval completion |

originContent: | `close-issue` | Handle issue close events | On `issues: [closed]` events |
translatedContent: | `close-issue` | Handle issue close events | On `issues: [closed]` events |

originContent: | `workflow` | Workflow name from config (for `request` action) | For `request` | - |
translatedContent: | `workflow` | Workflow name from config (for `request` action) | For `request` | - |

originContent: | `version` | Semver version for tag creation (e.g., `1.2.3` or `v1.2.3`) | No | - |
translatedContent: | `version` | Semver version for tag creation (e.g., `1.2.3` or `v1.2.3`) | No | - |

originContent: | `token` | GitHub token for API operations | Yes | - |
translatedContent: | `token` | GitHub token for API operations | Yes | - |

originContent: | `config_path` | Path to approvals.yml config file | No | `.github/approvals.yml` |
translatedContent: | `config_path` | Path to approvals.yml config file | No | `.github/approvals.yml` |

originContent: | `config_repo` | External repository for shared config (e.g., `org/.github`) | No | - |
translatedContent: | `config_repo` | External repository for shared config (e.g., `org/.github`) | No | - |

originContent: | `wait` | Wait for approval (polling) instead of returning immediately | No | `false` |
translatedContent: | `wait` | Wait for approval (polling) instead of returning immediately | No | `false` |

originContent: | `app_id` | GitHub App ID for team membership checks | No | - |
translatedContent: | `app_id` | GitHub App ID for team membership checks | No | - |

originContent: | `app_private_key` | GitHub App private key for team membership checks | No | - |
translatedContent: | `app_private_key` | GitHub App private key for team membership checks | No | - |

originContent: | `jira_user_email` | Jira user email for API authentication | No | - |
translatedContent: | `jira_user_email` | Jira user email for API authentication | No | - |

originContent: | `jira_api_token` | Jira API token for authentication | No | - |
translatedContent: | `jira_api_token` | Jira API token for authentication | No | - |

originContent: | `jira_update_fix_version` | Update Jira issues with Fix Version on approval | No | `true` |
translatedContent: | `jira_update_fix_version` | Update Jira issues with Fix Version on approval | No | `true` |

originContent: | `include_jira_issues` | Include Jira issues in approval request body | No | `true` |
translatedContent: | `include_jira_issues` | Include Jira issues in approval request body | No | `true` |

originContent: | `create_deployment` | Create GitHub deployment for tracking | No | `true` |
translatedContent: | `create_deployment` | Create GitHub deployment for tracking | No | `true` |

originContent: | `deployment_environment_url` | URL to the deployed environment | No | - |
translatedContent: | `deployment_environment_url` | URL to the deployed environment | No | - |

originContent: | `previous_tag` | Previous tag to compare commits against (auto-detected if not specified) | No | - |
translatedContent: | `previous_tag` | Previous tag to compare commits against (auto-detected if not specified) | No | - |

originContent: | `issue_number` | Created or checked issue number | All actions |
translatedContent: | `issue_number` | Created or checked issue number | All actions |

originContent: | `issue_url` | URL to the approval issue | All actions |
translatedContent: | `issue_url` | URL to the approval issue | All actions |

originContent: | `approvers` | Comma-separated list of users who approved | `process-comment`, `check` |
translatedContent: | `approvers` | Comma-separated list of users who approved | `process-comment`, `check` |

originContent: | `satisfied_group` | Name of the group that satisfied approval | `process-comment`, `check` |
translatedContent: | `satisfied_group` | Name of the group that satisfied approval | `process-comment`, `check` |

originContent: | `jira_issues` | Comma-separated list of Jira issue keys in this release | `request` |
translatedContent: | `jira_issues` | Comma-separated list of Jira issue keys in this release | `request` |

originContent: | `jira_issues_json` | JSON array of Jira issue details (key, summary, type, status) | `request` |
translatedContent: | `jira_issues_json` | JSON array of Jira issue details (key, summary, type, status) | `request` |

originContent: | `deployment_id` | GitHub deployment ID for status updates | `request` |
translatedContent: | `deployment_id` | GitHub deployment ID for status updates | `request` |

originContent: | `deployment_url` | URL to the deployment in GitHub | `request` |
translatedContent: | `deployment_url` | URL to the deployment in GitHub | `request` |

originContent: | `release_notes` | Auto-generated release notes from commits and Jira issues | `request` |
translatedContent: | `release_notes` | Auto-generated release notes from commits and Jira issues | `request` |

originContent: | `commits_count` | Number of commits in this release | `request` |
translatedContent: | `commits_count` | Number of commits in this release | `request` |

originContent: Policies define reusable groups of approvers. There are two formats:
translatedContent: Policies define reusable groups of approvers. There are two formats:

originContent: # Threshold-based: X of N must approve
translatedContent: # Threshold-based: X of N must approve

originContent: For complex requirements like "2 from platform AND 1 from security":
translatedContent: For complex requirements like "2 from platform AND 1 from security":

originContent: - user: alice             # alice must also approve
translatedContent: - user: alice             # alice must also approve

originContent: logic: and                  # ALL sources must be satisfied
translatedContent: logic: and                  # ALL sources must be satisfied

originContent: logic: or                   # ANY source is enough
translatedContent: logic: or                   # ANY source is enough

originContent: - `logic: and` - ALL sources must be satisfied (default)
translatedContent: - `logic: and` - ALL sources must be satisfied (default)

originContent: - `logic: or` - ANY source being satisfied is enough
translatedContent: - `logic: or` - ANY source being satisfied is enough

originContent: For complex expressions, use `logic:` on each source to specify how it connects to the next:
translatedContent: For complex expressions, use `logic:` on each source to specify how it connects to the next:

originContent: logic: and              # AND with next source
translatedContent: logic: and              # AND with next source

originContent: logic: or               # OR with next source
translatedContent: logic: or               # OR with next source

originContent: - user: alice            # alice alone can satisfy
translatedContent: - user: alice            # alice alone can satisfy

originContent: # (security AND platform) OR (alice AND bob) OR manager
translatedContent: # (security AND platform) OR (alice AND bob) OR manager

originContent: logic: or               # End first AND group
translatedContent: logic: or               # End first AND group

originContent: logic: or               # End second AND group
translatedContent: logic: or               # End second AND group

originContent: **Operator precedence:** AND binds tighter than OR (standard boolean logic).
translatedContent: **Operator precedence:** AND binds tighter than OR (standard boolean logic).

originContent: The expression `A and B or C and D` is evaluated as `(A AND B) OR (C AND D)`.
translatedContent: The expression `A and B or C and D` is evaluated as `(A AND B) OR (C AND D)`.

originContent: Workflows define approval requirements and actions:
translatedContent: Workflows define approval requirements and actions:

originContent: # Actions when issue is manually closed
translatedContent: # Actions when issue is manually closed

originContent: delete_tag: true   # Delete the tag if issue is closed
translatedContent: delete_tag: true   # Delete the tag if issue is closed

originContent: Control how tags are created per workflow:
translatedContent: Control how tags are created per workflow:

originContent: | `prefix` | Version prefix (inferred from `start_version` if not set) |
translatedContent: | `prefix` | Version prefix (inferred from `start_version` if not set) |

originContent: You can fully customize the issue body using Go templates. Use `body` for inline templates or `body_file` to load from a file.
translatedContent: You can fully customize the issue body using Go templates. Use `body` for inline templates or `body_file` to load from a file.

originContent: | `{{.CommitsCount}}` | Number of commits in this release |
translatedContent: | `{{.CommitsCount}}` | Number of commits in this release |

originContent: Global defaults that apply to all workflows:
translatedContent: Global defaults that apply to all workflows:

originContent: allow_self_approval: false      # Whether requestors can approve their own requests
translatedContent: allow_self_approval: false      # Whether requestors can approve their own requests

originContent: issue_labels:                   # Labels added to all approval issues
translatedContent: issue_labels:                   # Labels added to all approval issues

originContent: strategy: input          # Use version from input
translatedContent: strategy: input          # Use version from input

originContent: allow_prerelease: true   # Allow prerelease versions (e.g., v1.0.0-beta.1)
translatedContent: allow_prerelease: true   # Allow prerelease versions (e.g., v1.0.0-beta.1)

originContent: This section documents **every configuration option** available in `approvals.yml`.
translatedContent: This section documents **every configuration option** available in `approvals.yml`.

originContent: | `timeout` | duration | `72h` | Timeout for blocking `check` action with `wait: true`. Use hours (e.g., `168h` for 1 week). Not needed for event-driven workflows. |
translatedContent: | `timeout` | duration | `72h` | Timeout for blocking `check` action with `wait: true`. Use hours (e.g., `168h` for 1 week). Not needed for event-driven workflows. |

translatedContent: | `allow_self_approval` | bool | `false` | Whether the requestor can approve their own request |

translatedContent: | `issue_labels` | string[] | `[]` | Labels added to all approval issues |

translatedContent: | `approvers` | string[] | - | List of usernames or `team:slug` references |

translatedContent: | `min_approvals` | int | 0 | Number of approvals required (0 = use `require_all`) |

translatedContent: | `require_all` | bool | `false` | If true, ALL approvers must approve |

originContent: - `Organization > Members: Read` - To list team members

originContent: Track deployments through multiple environments with a single approval issue. As each stage is approved, the issue updates to show progress and automatically advances to the next stage.
translatedContent: Track deployments through multiple environments with a single approval issue. As each stage is approved, the issue updates to show progress and automatically advances to the next stage.

translatedContent: To disable the Mermaid diagram, set `show_mermaid_diagram: false` in the pipeline config.

translatedContent: show_quick_actions: true    # Show Quick Actions section (default: true)

originContent: Use `auto_approve: true` on pipeline stages that should be automatically approved without human intervention. This is ideal for lower environments like `dev` or `integration` where you want to speed up the pipeline while still maintaining approval gates for production.
translatedContent: Use `auto_approve: true` on pipeline stages that should be automatically approved without human intervention. This is ideal for lower environments like `dev` or `integration` where you want to speed up the pipeline while still maintaining approval gates for production.

originContent: 1. When a pipeline issue is created, all initial `auto_approve: true` stages are automatically completed
translatedContent: 1. When a pipeline issue is created, all initial `auto_approve: true` stages are automatically completed

originContent: 2. When a stage is manually approved, any consecutive `auto_approve: true` stages that follow are also automatically completed
translatedContent: 2. When a stage is manually approved, any consecutive `auto_approve: true` stages that follow are also automatically completed

originContent: 3. Auto-approved stages show with ðŸ¤– indicator in the pipeline table
translatedContent: 3. Auto-approved stages show with ðŸ¤– indicator in the pipeline table

originContent: 4. The approver is recorded as `[auto]` in the stage history
translatedContent: 4. The approver is recorded as `[auto]` in the stage history

originContent: - **Development environments**: Deploy immediately without waiting for approval
translatedContent: - **Development environments**: Deploy immediately without waiting for approval

originContent: - **Integration testing**: Let CI/CD pipeline progress automatically through test environments
translatedContent: - **Integration testing**: Let CI/CD pipeline progress automatically through test environments

originContent: - **Canary deployments**: Auto-approve canary stage, require approval for full rollout
translatedContent: - **Canary deployments**: Auto-approve canary stage, require approval for full rollout

originContent: | `track_prs` | `false` | Include merged PRs in the issue body |
translatedContent: | `track_prs` | `false` | Include merged PRs in the issue body |

originContent: | `compare_from_tag` | - | Custom tag pattern to compare from |
translatedContent: | `compare_from_tag` | - | Custom tag pattern to compare from |

originContent: | `show_mermaid_diagram` | `true` | Show visual Mermaid flowchart of pipeline stages |
translatedContent: | `show_mermaid_diagram` | `true` | Show visual Mermaid flowchart of pipeline stages |

originContent: **Note:** PR tracking requires `pull-requests: read` permission in your workflow.
translatedContent: **Note:** PR tracking requires `pull-requests: read` permission in your workflow.

originContent: In enterprise environments, PRs merged to main aren't always immediate release candidates. The approval engine supports three strategies for selecting which PRs belong to a release:
translatedContent: In enterprise environments, PRs merged to main aren't always immediate release candidates. The approval engine supports three strategies for selecting which PRs belong to a release:

originContent: | `tag` | PRs between two git tags (default) | Simple releases, trunk-based development |
translatedContent: | `tag` | PRs between two git tags (default) | Simple releases, trunk-based development |

originContent: | `branch` | PRs merged to a release branch | GitFlow, release branches |
translatedContent: | `branch` | PRs merged to a release branch | GitFlow, release branches |

originContent: | `label` | PRs with a specific release label | Flexible selection, batched releases |
translatedContent: | `label` | PRs with a specific release label | Flexible selection, batched releases |

originContent: | `milestone` | PRs assigned to a GitHub milestone | Roadmap-aligned releases |
translatedContent: | `milestone` | PRs assigned to a GitHub milestone | Roadmap-aligned releases |

originContent: type: milestone  # or: tag, branch, label
translatedContent: type: milestone  # or: tag, branch, label

originContent: close_after_release: true       # Close milestone on prod completion
translatedContent: close_after_release: true       # Close milestone on prod completion

originContent: # Auto-create next release artifact on completion
translatedContent: # Auto-create next release artifact on completion

originContent: create_issue: true              # Create new approval issue
translatedContent: create_issue: true              # Create new approval issue

originContent: Use release branches for GitFlow-style development:
translatedContent: Use release branches for GitFlow-style development:

originContent: delete_after_release: true      # Cleanup after prod deploy
translatedContent: delete_after_release: true      # Cleanup after prod deploy

originContent: 2. PRs merged to the branch are release candidates
translatedContent: 2. PRs merged to the branch are release candidates

originContent: 4. Approval issue shows all PRs in the release branch
translatedContent: 4. Approval issue shows all PRs in the release branch

originContent: 5. After prod, branch is deleted (optional) and next branch is created
translatedContent: 5. After prod, branch is deleted (optional) and next branch is created

originContent: Use labels for flexible PR selection:
translatedContent: Use labels for flexible PR selection:

originContent: pending_label: "pending-release"    # Applied to merged PRs awaiting release
translatedContent: pending_label: "pending-release"    # Applied to merged PRs awaiting release

originContent: remove_after_release: true          # Remove label after prod deploy
translatedContent: remove_after_release: true          # Remove label after prod deploy

originContent: 1. PRs merged to main get the `pending-release` label
translatedContent: 1. PRs merged to main get the `pending-release` label

originContent: 2. Release manager applies `release:v1.2.0` to selected PRs
translatedContent: 2. Release manager applies `release:v1.2.0` to selected PRs

originContent: 4. Approval issue shows only PRs with that label
translatedContent: 4. Approval issue shows only PRs with that label

originContent: 5. After prod, labels are removed and next release label is created
translatedContent: 5. After prod, labels are removed and next release label is created

originContent: close_after_release: true            # Close milestone on completion
translatedContent: close_after_release: true            # Close milestone on completion

originContent: create_issue: true                   # Auto-create next approval issue
translatedContent: create_issue: true                   # Auto-create next approval issue

originContent: 2. Assign PRs to the milestone during development
translatedContent: 2. Assign PRs to the milestone during development

originContent: 4. Approval issue shows all PRs in the milestone
translatedContent: 4. Approval issue shows all PRs in the milestone

originContent: 5. After prod, milestone is closed and next milestone is created
translatedContent: 5. After prod, milestone is closed and next milestone is created

translatedContent: When the final stage (prod) is approved, automatically prepare for the next release:

translatedContent: next_version: patch      # Calculate next: patch, minor, or major

originContent: create_issue: true       # Create new approval issue immediately
translatedContent: create_issue: true       # Create new approval issue immediately

originContent: - **Branch strategy:** New release branch from main
translatedContent: - **Branch strategy:** New release branch from main

translatedContent: Each strategy has optional cleanup actions that run when the final stage (prod) is approved. **All cleanup options default to `false`** - cleanup is opt-in:

translatedContent: | Label | `remove_after_release` | Remove release labels from PRs |

translatedContent: delete_after_release: false   # Keep branch for reference (default)

translatedContent: | **Branch** | Clear release scope, isolation | Branch management overhead |

translatedContent: | **Label** | Flexible selection, easy to change | Manual labeling required |

translatedContent: | **Milestone** | Roadmap visibility, planning integration | Requires milestone discipline |

originContent: - Use **tag** for simple projects with continuous deployment
translatedContent: - Use **tag** for simple projects with continuous deployment

originContent: - Use **branch** for regulated environments needing release isolation
translatedContent: - Use **branch** for regulated environments needing release isolation

originContent: - Use **label** for batched releases with flexible scope
translatedContent: - Use **label** for batched releases with flexible scope

originContent: - Use **milestone** for roadmap-driven development with clear release planning
translatedContent: - Use **milestone** for roadmap-driven development with clear release planning

originContent: Automatically extract Jira issues from commits and branch names. The action supports two modes:
translatedContent: Automatically extract Jira issues from commits and branch names. The action supports two modes:

originContent: Just provide `jira_base_url` to extract issue keys and display them as clickable links:
translatedContent: Just provide `jira_base_url` to extract issue keys and display them as clickable links:

originContent: This extracts issue keys (e.g., `PROJ-123`) from commit messages and branch names, displaying them as links in the approval issue:
translatedContent: This extracts issue keys (e.g., `PROJ-123`) from commit messages and branch names, displaying them as links in the approval issue:
